message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.SE, cs.IT, cs.NI

The paper discusses a cyber-attack that involves the use of keyboard LEDs to exfiltrate data from air-gapped computers. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also explores the hardware and software characteristics of modern USB keyboards, which could be classified under human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and software engineering (cs.SE). The use of smartphones and smartwatch cameras as components of the attack could also be considered under networked and distributed systems (cs.NI) and information theory (cs.IT).
